I say 4 stars because of the timely food preparation. Also, the homely atmosphere and kind people. My first time here. The chicken fried steak I got was ...mmmm fine. I've had better and possibly had worse.   Thanks for the hospitality and I will definitely send people over.   Cheers!

Walked in and wad greeted promptly by the staff with a good morning. Was seated promplty and my waitress arrived shortly after. I ordered the daily steak and eggs breakfast special. Was very surprised my food arrived at my table within 10 min of order. Food was awesome, everything was made specifically to order, however did lack flavor. this place reminds me of my childhood and back home in the country, going to breakfast at the local breakfast place.  I will definitely be back.
One of our favorite breakfast places. I like the country fried steak and eggs. They are always packed but are quick and friendly. Portions are large, pancakes are the size of a small pizza

By far one of the best meals I have had in a very long time. I had the Paula and Jim skillet and was not disappointed! Huge portion and reasonably priced! We added a short stack and thank goodness we shared it! The service was amazing from the moment  I stepped in the door. I immediately felt like they knew me and had been friends for years. Highly recommend this amazing joint! Small town atmosphere with home cooked goodness!
Very nice little place. It sort of reminded me of The Place before it became bigger and lost a bit of quality. Great portion sizes and even better prices.

Great little mom and pop gem in Glendale.  Tried this place for or the first time this afternoon after seeing the reviews.  French dip sandwich and Ronnie's special (cheeseburger with pastrami) were both excellent.  Great fries.  Portions were large, great value for the price, which was very affordable.  Service was friendly and fast!  Best peach tea we've had in quite some time.  This is a new family fave;-). Thanks for all the previous reviews!

AMAZING!! I have been to Ronnie's twice and each time had absolutely the best service and food. The portions are HUGE and services very quick. I thought I would be waiting a long time for my breakfast because they were pretty full when I walked in however she brought my plate out even before I was ready LOL   I ordered the country fried steak and it was served with home fries and homemade toasted bread and two eggs. The potatoes are definitely not frozen and the country fried steak was amazing. I also got an order of "one pancake", it is literally the size of a dinner plate and awesome tasting  AANNDD....have I mentioned that they make their own butter??. Highly recommended!!

Stopped in here Saturday  morning after some friends suggested it and, of course, I had Yelped it.  Julie wasn't sure when they opened (6AM) so I got there about 6:45 and the place was already about 1/3 full.  The waitress, who appeared to be old enough to be my mother, made sure I knew about the senior menu on the back cover.  The service was pretty good.  They initially forgot me as I had been seated in the front corner but after that I was checked on on a regular basis.  I am pretty sure all 3 of the waitresses were seniors and they put a lot of younger servers to shame as they bustled around taking care of their and each others customers.  Definite teamwork in play.  Many of the customers appeared to be regulars as they chatted with the waitresses and folks at other tables.  I may have ordered the wrong thing.  I had the Sh-- on a shingle with 2 eggs on the side and a large glass of orange juice.  It consisted of their standard white gravy with some shreds of corned beef on top.  The basic gravy had a pepper taste which I have had before in diners but I would have assumed the dish would be made with chipped beef.  Probably not ordered consistently enough to make it worth while.  Even after eating my eggs the gravy was scalding hot and I was surprised it had not separated or filmed over, which would have been my luck doing it at home.  Total bill w/tax $9.51, and I was full.  Overall the place had a good vibe to it.  It opens early enough I want to stop in and try some of the breakfast specials that are only available on weekdays.
Good food, a LOT of food... Pancakes are crazy large but good. The meat lover omelet is big enough for two meals!

Ronnie's Cafe is a quaint and unique cafe that serves breakfast and lunch. This was my husband and my first visit after viewing our friend's Facebook posting from his recent visit. The portions are enormous and very filling. We ordered breakfast. I had the country gravy, sausage and eggs Benedict with home fries. My husband ordered the scrambled eggs, sausage and French toast. We both ordered coffee and ice water. Every bite melted in my mouth. The sausage was some of the best I have ever eaten. The service was outstanding. Our server was Tara and she was attentive, always refilling our coffee and checking on us.  The restaurant is clean as is the restrooms. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. They have regulars that come.  We will return in the future.

The food was amazing and the waitress was awesome however, there was mold on the sandwich break. They brought out a new sandwich but the appetite was gone.  They made it seem like the new sandwich was on the house but at the register they were trying to charge it. After asking another waitress and getting nowhere they brought out the manager. After all the confusion and commotion they finally figured it out. However, they thought that no one was listening but one person from the group stayed behind and heard another waitress and the manager talking about "the lady and the mold." I find this really disrespectful and unprofessional.

Ronnies is always a solid choice for diner style breakfast. The suite is filled with tchotchkes like mugs and wall decor which gives the table a conversation starter. The staff is always friendly and although they are usually busier than a hot chick's Tinder inbox they are attentive. Yeah, sure the parking is less than desirable, but price and quality are worth it.
cute interior, fast service, delicious food...and TONS of it!  Will definitely be coming back!
Great prices, cute restaurant, friendly people, good service, and amazing food. Too bad they're not open for dinner.

Been here: 20-30 times  Ronnie's is pretty good (there's a reason I keep coming back) but should come with a few words of caution for non-regulars and newcomers (why I give it a 3).   What's good: the food is consistently OK to good (75% of the time), the wait staff (on the floor) is quite friendly, and the prices and portion sizes are hard to beat.    What you may, or may not, like: the food is quite greasy- I actually enjoy that, but know some people have a hard time with (or are turned off by) greasy foods.  What you need to be warned about: I have had a few experiences of less than exceptional customer service at the front of the restaurant.  In specific, I had a particularly unpleasant experience with a staff member at the cash register.  Unfortunately, from reading other reviews, I don't think that is as uncommon as I'd hope it to be.  What to know: Although they don't have a sign, do wait to be seated at the front. You will also pay up front when you're done.   In short: This is a local, mom n' pop cafe with some of the quirks that come with that.  Food is pretty consistent and service is usually good.  Wouldn't recommend going out of your way for it, but would mention it to a local interested in giving it a try.  I would not bring guests here due to the lack of consistency in food quality and service (I made that mistake).  If you do have guests, I would recommend checking out Black Bear diner, which is a safer option with much of the same local charm.

I live and work across Ronnies Cafe and I'm utterly impressed. This is my very first time trying their lunch and my jaw dropped when I opened my to go box. Believe me when I say it looked as delicious as it tasted. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

If you want large portions and good food come to Ronnie's Cafe. We have visited several times already and we are very impressed. The service is good and the food is excellent. Some of our favorites are the Florentine omelette, chicken fried steak, corned beef hash, and waffles. We just found this place a couple of months ago as it is hidden a bit from Cactus Rd. Take some time to come find it. You won't be disappointed!

The staff blew me away with their amazing customer service. We were only in Pheonix for a few hours before heading home but this place was the perfect place to experience Arizona hospitality. We also got great souvenirs when our delicious meal was over. Good vibes and great times!

Haven't been here in a while. Prices for quality are too high. Over medium eggs were runny, French toast was cold. Waitress was very nice but came for the food & was very disappointed. We were here when first opened 11 years ago. Probably won't be back

Went for breakfast, had the corn beef hash, it was disgusting tasted like ground up hotdogs or some sorta cheap spam product....couldn't even cook scrambled eggs right, I saw on the menu shit on a shingle, had that when I was kid and make it from time to time, again there using this Cheap spam products or god only knows...very disgusting almost threw up right there bye the smell of this food!!! Wouldn't not recommend!!!
Always friendly service and good food.  Prices are low and portions are big.  The waitresses are very nice.

We can't come to Phoenix and not go to ronnies. Everyone is so nice.  Food is always great.  This time had the tom and penny skillet, I think that's what it was called, it was very good.  Wife just wanted eggs and sausage, and they took care of her.  Come get you some.
Got the huge chicken fried steak.  Fresh gravy, tender meat, spiced just right.   Cobb salad was priced right.

One of my favorite places for breakfast food.  This is coming from a guy who never goes out for breakfast.  I'm simply not a big fan of it.  I am though, a fan of breakfast being done right.  Generous servings, great tasting food, and a very at-home style atmosphere.  The only thing I'm against the all the random items on the wall with prices.  It makes it feel a little too much like a flea market.    If it didn't have price tags, it would feel more like charm instead of someone trying to make a quick buck.
This place is a must try when you are in AZ. This a family-style restaurant. I can't wait to come back again.

Big portions, good prices and a friendly greeter will bring us back for breakfast. Our waitress was very efficient but she could have been more friendly. She may have had too many tables to cover. We'll have to try their lunch, the menu looks great!
Great food, prepared any way you like it, large quantities, and low prices. Fantastic place and fun people working there.

This review is strictly for hostess.  We had a group of seven but one of our party is a very large man so we asked for a table for 8.  She said ok but then made it a joke shout out friend.  We decided to still have breakfast but it will be our last visit.  We have been coming here for years and they have just lost a good customer because of a hostess's decision to be disrespectful.  Which is something that is just not acceptable.  Oh.  In the off chance there is some confusion as to why we will not return?  WENDY is the reason.  Rudeness will not be tolerated.  You are in a service industry and she should be very aware of her surroundings!  I am sure she did not intend for my wife and her friend to hear her however they did.  Sorry Ronnie's.

Absolutely the best place ever . GREAT homemade cooking . This is like grandmas homemade cooking . I've been here several times everything is good and there is no other place around town that taste so fresh and authentic like this place. Definitely worth your time. And the portion sizes are huge! I would recommend and item but everything taste good like really

Good food, huge portions (they're ok with sharing), and terrible coffee. I am immediately enamored when I order my potatoes crispy, and they show up that way! (The breakfast potatoes were the best part of the meal.)Nice place if you're wanting to sit and chat. The staff was extremely friendly.

Went for breakfast this morning had the Tony and Jill I think it was called Chirzo jalapeños egg ect. With toast and side of bacon. It was huge had to take home some. My meal was only 15.00 even. But what made it great was my waitress don't know here name but on the bill it said server number 16. She was very friendly had a smile and was on top of everything plus she was very attractive. Would recommend Ronnie's to anyone who wants good homemade meals and hopefully you would get server 16 cause she is very good.

I found this place by accident after doing some errands. I came in by myself to try out the breakfast. This is probably the best breakfast that I have had in Phoenix. I had the corned beef and hash with two eggs over easy country potatoes and a biscuit. Bravo! I can't wait to come back and try it some other dishes. Definitely worth the 5 stars that I gave it!!! Lyndsey was awesome. Very friendly and made me feel welcome.

Wow! That was fast and delicious. They didn't waist anytime. I brought my daughter here with me. We usually go and do Black Bear Diner, but they have gone a little south lately. So now Ronnie's will be our family diner. Thanks for the great experience. FYI: All of the items on the wall are for sale! That's pretty cool.
Breakfast done old school. Lots to look at while enjoying the food. We did breakfast. Giant pancakes that were on the money. Great value.

Great little place with large portions. Just friendly and smashing food! What I going to be cute was you could buy anything on their walls. Like pictures or memorabilia.  Since I  saw the portion sizes before I ordered, I got something small. My husband got the make you own omelette and could not finish it since it was huge. All the food and service was great! Will come back.
The best homefries/fried potatoes in town laid back family restaurant. ...took my mom back the very next day she too gave it 5 stars for the food !!!

This is a great breakfast hangout. The pancakes are delicious and HUGE. The serving sizes are big so me and my hubby share and still have left overs. It can get busy and it's not the biggest building so plan on waiting.

Yuck!! The food was incredibly bad. I got the eggs benedict and my husband got the country fried steak. Both tasted disgusting. We also got a pancake and wished we hadn't. The syrup tasted nothing like syrup. The food is over priced considering it tastes so bad and isn't fresh at all. I was charged $4.95 for a small bowl of fruit that was really warm to the touch. Don't understand how this place stays in business. Pure nastiness!

If you're looking for home style American cooking, this is your place. Good food, good prices and friendly casual dining. They make their own "home fries", which are country style potatoes. Always go with this choice as a side whenever possible! Sometimes they have homemade bread too. Their pancakes are literally the size of a plate, so you probably only need one. Homemade chicken fried steak is incredible. Reuben sandwich is perfect. Seriously, if you're looking for diner type food this is the place. They only do breakfast and lunch. One of my all time favorite restaurants in the valley.

Tried this place for the first time last Sunday after mass (also the weekend of superbowl) and it was absolutely amazing.   There was already a wait at 940am but glad we decided to wait based on all the awesome reviews.  We actually didnt wait that long maybe about 10 mins if that.  Best part was they were selling girl scout cookies right outside! Haha anyway the restaurant decor is full of colorful things hanging on the walls.  Little did we know most of the items on the walls are for sale!  If you look closely you will see a small price tag on the item somewhere.  Now the food.. is amazing!   The portions are definitely huge, no matter what you order its literally going to fill the entire plate! Saw someone eating the paula and jim's omlette special and ordered that with potatoes and wheat toast.  The boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs for only 6.99.  The omlette was definitely everything and the kitchen sink, filled with bacon, sausage, ham and some other herbs and seasoning all smothered in melty cheesey goodness! Came on a skillet and kept it hot the entire time I was devouring the meal! Loved that the waitress offered salsa with it and their salsa is pretty good with a very nice kick of jalapeños.   Anyway... what I loved most was that their toast had a generous amount of butter that melted nicely on the toast.  Most places are very stingey with their butter as if butter was costly!  But this place gave me enough where I was happy :).  Anyway the steak and eggs are definitely worth it.  Its a good size sirloin steak,  might be about 8 to 10oz maybe.  It was cooked a little more than med rare but thats okay since its not a steak house the slight overcooking is okay,  therefore you may wanna do one level undercooked to expect it to be slightly over cooked when you get the steak.  But the food was soo good it was still good the day after for lunch at work!!  Will definitely come back again!

Giving this place a solid 4 for now. The staff was excellent and the eclectic wall decor was amusing, but the food was just good not great. My boyfriend got the pastrami burger and I got the french toast, which was the better of the two. The toast was thick and filling, I enjoyed ir enough. The main thing that would have improved the meal is the fries and burger could have used some more seasoning. We were hoping this place might be out new breakfast spot since moving to the area, but I'm sure. I would still go back though and encourage anyone looking for good cheap eats to try them out.

Our group of 10 members came for a breakfast meeting at Ronnie's.  Since I had called as they asked the day before, they had tables and chairs and set-ups all ready when we walked in at 9 a.m.  Great greeting for a group! We all loved this place!  The huge portions, the good food and the great service really made this event super--and the reasonable price for the food just topped it all off.  More than one person said to come back here when we meet again...and we will! We stayed for 2 hours, loved everything here and will definitely do a repeat in the near future!  Ronnie's Cafe is an excellent breakfast place for us! Our waitress handled the 10 of us with no problem it seemed, and her service was so appreciated.  She was quick, efficient and friendly.  No complaints here. Lots of parking out front and homey atmosphere--almost MIdwestern in it's way--which is  missing in so many places in Phoenix which seems to go for the modern, sterile look that is boring and uninteresting.  We loved the kitchy stuff for sale on their walls, frankly....crazy and we loved it.  We spent part of our time just reading the signs they have up for sale. By the way, try the omelettes--just the size alone will blow you away!

This is our absolute favorite breakfast place!  We used to live just a couple of blocks away, but now we live on the North East side of town and still drive over often.  Ronnie's has the best potatoes I've ever had in a restaurant - EVER!  Portions are huge, never once have I cleaned my plate, although I wanted to.  Service is always warm and friendly and prices are low by comparison to most breakfast places.  Seriously worth the drive if you don't live in this area of town.

This is our second time here, its awesome for breakfast. Service is great n portions n good also. The inside layput is cool because they have stuff on the walls that u can purchase. R.I.P marlon we miss u this time around n u were wit us last time. Must come n try..prices r good n alot of selection in food.

Met a friend here for breakfast while i was in town. there is a ton of great things on this menu but i wasnt really prepared when it was time to order and threw out pigs and a blanket. Not what i really wanted but i was good and service was great.  I would eat the pigs in a blanket again but wouldnt order it again because there is to many good things on this menu.

My boyfriend took me to Ronnie's for the first time almost a year ago.  We both agree it is the BEST food and service we've ever had!  The staff there are all wonderful and treat everyone like family!  I cannot say enough good about this place, keep up the good work and see you all soon!!!

I've been here on two occasions and service has been pretty nice. I've tried the breakfast sandwich and the french toast and the food is definitely better than the standard Ihop/Denny's chain breakfasts. Portion sizes are bigger than usual. Staff is very friendly.

We were out in Arizona for spring training and I always trust Yelp when looking for "the breakfast spot".  Ronnie's came up as #1, so I dragged the family 15 minutes outta our way for crap!  The restaurant staff were nice, but unfortunately that doesn't make the food taste better .  My daughter sent back her eggs because they were brown.  The waitress didn't understand what was wrong with them.  My daughter said she wanted them yellow and fluffy.  When her plate was returned, they looked wet and brown.  I gave her permission not to eat them.  The sourdough toast was burnt hard and cold, like it was sitting out for a while.  The bacon was a dirty oil brown color, but looked soggy.  My kids love bacon, but they couldn't eat the two strips they got.  I got the 2 egg Bfast, which came with oatmeal.  I only ate the oatmeal, which was very good.  Everything was just bad overall.  Over half the food was left untouched on our plates.  I don't know all these yelpers who gave them great reviews, but I'm telling you don't waste your money.

Love this place.  Stumbled upon it one day and so glad we did.  It's like a little coffee shop diner.  My husband and I go all the time for breakfast.  Large portions at a decent price and so good.  staff is very friendly and it can get very busy at times, but it is worth the wait.  Pancakes are bigger than the plate and the home fries are delicious.  no matter how busy it is, your food comes out pretty quick.  Everything I have had so far is great and really want to make it there for lunch.  breakfast is delicious.

I can NOT say enough about how great this place is. The people that work there have been working there FOR-ever. And all their sassy attitude makes me want to come back everyday. Not to mention I get coupons for this place in the mail at least once a month. I love trying new things, but their biscuits and gravy will stick to you all day. And they have a great el cheap -o menu if you get there before 10:30. What? Breakfast with me soon, why yes please. :)
Quaint Cafe with character and huge delicious meals. You can even shop for items on the wall - eating with a bonus!

I'm always on the hunt for a local breakfast place and I've found one of the best. I love going out for breakfast but don't care for chain breakfast restaurants so happy to find this place. Not only is the food amazing but the portions are out of the world and the service I'd the best.   Give it a try and you won't be let down.

Friends took me here for breakfast.  They have been coming here for years.  It is a local mom & pop operation serving mostly breakast food all day and lunch items.  Service was ok.  Food was not bad and you get a nice portion.  I got the special with pancakes.  They were ok.  I have had better.  The syrup made it go down better.  I thought they were a tad overcooked but some people like it that way. Prices are decent.  I like to support mom & pop restaurants like this.  There are not the best but not that bad also.

Stopped by last weekend for their signature 'steak - egg' combo breakfast, which was a disappointment.  Steak was tough, stringy, marbled with fat and gristle. Would have been better served to Spike (the pit bull barking out front of the restaurant). Eggs were runny and the toast was limp and disgusting.     Coffee...tasted like canal water. Service was slow, restaurant was overcrowded with a 'motley crew' of trenchermen who obviously had not been fed since being let out from their trailer parks a couple weeks ago.     Other than that, a great place full of unusual smells, odors, stains on the floor and walls, and decrepit furnishings that have all seen better days.

Really good food, came here because of Yelp and I am sick of the same old breakfast places.  It is a great little casual hole in the wall (maybe a little bigger), old grandma decor, could pass on the roosters on the table cloth.  Service was good, but there were some white trash people sitting next to me that could not stop cursing every other word.  It looked like a 40+ year old daughter with her dad too which made it worse.  The food on the other hand was great, the potatoes are real cut up potatoes that have been grilled crispy and lightly browned.  I ordered the special which was a green chilli omelet with swiss cheese covering it.   I would come back (what are the odds I would get WT sitting next to me again...right?).  Oh yeah, they have a steak and eggs special too for $5.99

This place is delicious.  Now, when I say delicious, I mean slap-yo-mama-do-a-dance-and-feel-the-magic-on-your-tastebuds good!! The man and I went here for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 10:30ish.  I wasn't sure if the after church crowd would have taken the place over by then, but we were willing to risk it.  We love little local dives and based on the reviews, we figured this was right up our alley. When we arrived, we were told that it would be about 15 minutes.  We waited on a couple of chairs outside and were called in less than five.  I had originally gone in with the intention of getting the egg croissant sandwich (a picture was posted), but then EVERYTHING looked good, so I wanted to try a little of everything. I got the "Julie's Everyday Breakfast" (or something like that... basically bacon and eggs) with the home fries and biscuits and gravy.  The man got the breakfast skillet with chorizo and we got a pancake (yes, just one) to share.  The coffee was refilled twice before our order got there.  Not because it took a long time, but because they're THAT on top of it.  Everything was fan-freaking-TASTIC.  We like to think of ourselves as connoisseurs of bacon and this was some of the best!  It was thick cut and crispy without being burnt.  The eggs were light and fluffy, the home fries were nicely cooked (but needed a touch of salt.)  The man's skillet was REALLY flavorful and had a kick without being TOO spicy (well, it was spicy for me, but i'm a honkey white girl... he added salsa and hot sauce to it...) He went with the server's suggestion to get tortillas on the side to make a couple of little breakfast burritos... which he did and he still had HALF of his breakfast left!! And the pancake was everything a pancake should be.  It was spongey but not soggy, sweet but not sugary and the sides spilled over the edge of the plate.  Yum!! The decor was that of a typical local diner.  The chairs were on casters which was nice; there were pictures and decorations covering the walls that were for sale and the plates were the usual beige color.  Sure, the carpet could use some updating and the plastic table cloths remind me of my grandma's house.  But overall, it was great and we will definitely be back and we'll be bringing our friends and their appetites!

Minimal wait time on a very busy Sunday morning. Walls covered with a wide variety of images and photos. My scrambled eggs were moist without being runny. Breakfast partner anointed the pancakes the best he's ever tasted. Everyone, from the cheerful and efficient waitstaff, to the host, to the cashier has a smile and a good word. I plan to return the next time I'm in town.

In all honesty, Ronnie's was OK. Nothing really stood out to me.. oh wait, they do have really good coffee.. but not enough for 5 stars.  I went I to Ronnie's today around 9am, was not greeted "Eye to Eye" but instead I received a "be with you in a minute" with a back turned. Once we were seated we had a minute to gaze around at all the interesting items for sale On the walls, pretty cool to have things to look at.  The server brought us waters and hunched down into a squat and assumed we were ready to order(I hadn't even noticed the menu in front of me). So I felt obligated to hurry up and order so I built my own omelette(can't go wrong with that) and my mom ordered the waffle meal. Again, the coffee was great. So our food came out (a rubber or another server delivered) and it was all pretty cold except the omelette. It looks like they had everything ready to go and just added the egg portions on the way out. Even the toast tasted old.  Anyway, I just asked for New toast because I don't really like complaining or sending anything back. The omelette was the best thing there although it is not served with any fixings like sour cream or anything so you'll need to order that on your own. The waffle was bland, the bacon was crispy(good crispy, the home fries were good(better  hey were fresh). So I would not have an issue going back but I'd rather hit up "The Place" near by for not only more bang for your buck but a fresher and more friendly experience.

We stopped at Ronnie's Cafe based upon other Yelp reviews. The wait staff was friendly, obviously was well known to the locals, and still very friendly to us out-of-towners. The portions were huge you could not possibly leave Ronnie's and still feel hungry.

Have been frequenting this place for a while. Had breakfast there yesterday and it was really disappointing. Bacon tasted like petroleum and was cold. The French toast was hard as a rock and it looked like they were trying to save a piece of old bread and ripped off only the corners and called it French toast. Not returning ever again. So many other breakfast places that are better.

I was headed for the Mexican place right nextg door, but decided to give this little diner a try.  I am glad I did.  A friendly staff, and HUGE portions made it a memorable stop!!  The pancakes fill the entire plate, and it's not a small plate either.  Plenty of good food, served hot and fresh and with a smile.  It's well worth the trip!
U won't ever find another breakfast place like Ronnie's. We've tried. It's delicious. Steak and Eggs for $6.99 everyday. Fried potatoes are on point.

I tried it because of the reviews.  Maybe it was an off day.  The home fries tasted like they had been cooked in old oil.  The staff was very friendly.  It is kitchy right out of the past.  No music was nice you could actually hear the person next to you.  Between the 3 of us we had eggs, bacon, home fries, french toast and a roast beef sandwich.  We were all of the opinion of Meh.  If a greasy spoon is your idea of great food then hurry in.  It was edible but not delicious.

The service was fantastic as was the food. Their corn beef hash is homemade... delicious. Pancakes are light fluffy and huge! I also recommend the biscuits and gravy. Stick to your ribs good. Get there between 6:00 and 10:30am for breakfast

Friendly and fast service! Place you want to eat your breakfast slow as possible so you can savor the goodness of their food and the nice ambiance of the place. Too bad you have to give way for the other customers...  My family and I went here and their food is fantastic, the servers are really friendly and the owner himself goes out to talk to the customers and ask how's the food.  I highly recommend this place for family weekend breakfast!

I went here for breakfast with my father this morning. And my fiance. Their food is always great sometimes they get a little busy and overwhelmed but the food makes up for it. I get to Julies everyday breakfast when I am there and they know how to make grits correctly. They have other great specials running all the time great food and this place is never a disappointment. I also like there fried potatoes are the best :-)

This is THE place to go for that small home-town atmosphere and amazingly big delicious breakfasts for that small home-town price. The wait staff are always professional, fun, and really take the time to get to know the regulars.  Don't let the line throw you off. We've never waited longer than 20-25 minutes, and it is well worth the wait. Tip: the earlier you go the shorter the wait if you can beat the church crowds.   5/5 for this local gem!
Good mom and pop place for breakfast or lunch. Large servings. Excellent service. Down home food.

This place can get very packed. Visited on a Saturday morning and luckily we only had to wait a few minutes. The waitress was nice and the food came out fairly quick. This is your "moms & pops" restaurant. Prices are awesome and you get lots of food. This will definitely be one of my favs for breakfast.

First time here came for lunch with father and brother . We were greeted by an older women who seated us pretty promptly.. Our waitress didn't come right away but when she showed up she was great. Our food was pretty good I got the chef salad and it was a decent size.. My only complainant was they didn't have the dressing that I wanted.. Dad and Brothers meals were pretty decent according to them.. I will go back and try something else in the future . Now the only thing that was really distracting was the little tiff between two of the waitress's , maybe not everyone saw it but I did.. A little professionalism goes a long ways ladies..

First off don't go to this place if you're looking for a fancy brunch with small portions. This is a good old fashioned diner with huge portions. Their food is never cold and their waitresses are busy but always helpful. I eat breakfast here I recommend their pancakes, omelettes, and their skillets.  This is a good place if you appreciate down home country cooking.

I love quaint family based breakfast joints. And After getting sat pretty quickly and finding my very favorite and hard to find breakfast item on the menu (cream dried beef aka SOS) I was sure Id end up driving across town more often to eat. Even getting our soup we requested ahead of time took awhile and it was just warm when we got it. It was good though. When our meals finallllyy came I was so disappointed. I know everyone has their own variation of SOS but this was not the recipe I cared for. Too much pepper and I didnt like the choice of meat they used. When it came time to pay, there is no room for a line at the register yet there was a very slow moving line.
Never had a bad meal in this place, HUGE portion and great prices. The staff is always friendly... Love when they have the Potato pancakes as a special, they are huge and so good.

Tried Ronnie's for the first time today.  Never would have noticed it without Yelp review.  Good service.  Good food.  Awesome potatoes.  Bacon sadly was overcooked.  Will take kids there and see what their opinion is since they are pickier than me:)

The most Southern style breakfast in Phoenix!!! The staff is incredibly friendly and the place just screams home style! The pancakes are MONSTROUS!!! Our breakfast came out quickly and everything was awesome. They certainly make sure you leave full... too full in fact. I loved seeing the entire staff meet and greet everyone like they were regulars. Come hungry!

Read the reviews on Yelp and thought this would be a great place to try and I wasn't disappointed.    The coffee was strong and hot and the food came the same way.  Had to wait to cool a little before digging in.  (Also may need doggie bag as the portions are big and the price is worth it)  Lots of locals and very friendly wait staff made this trip here worth the experience.

Holy crap!  This omelette was huge!  And good.  And so were the home fried potatoes, which are actually hash browns.   I went online to find the best breakfast places in Peoria and this place was at the top of the list.  Seemed very family-oriented in two ways: family friendly, yet locals seemed to be treated like family.  I felt very comfortable being here amongst the locals.  And a great thing happened while here. I was sitting next to some folks that were telling the waitress, whom they were aquainted with, about how they were interested in selling their 4 tickets to the Cards football game the next day. I asked them a few questions about the tickets. By the time I left the restaurant, I had two tickets and a parking pass for a better price than I could have ever gotten at the game. Thank you, whoever you are!!  Place was packed on this Saturday morning.  Great homey decor.  Service was excellent and everyone was friendly.   If you live in the area, you probably have been here.  If you haven't, you should go.

We are from out of state & we looked this place up on yelp so thought we'd give it a try. Quick attention at the door and seated right away. Cute little breakfast restaurant and walls are covered with so much to see (and buy if you want). Our waitress was Sandra and she was extremely sweet and attentive. Filled our coffees & water regularly and checked on us periodically to see if we needed anything else. Food came out quickly and we ordered country fried steak (2 orders) with pan potatoes, biscuit and gravy & Codd Combo with French toast & eggs. The meal country fried steak was delicious BUT the French toast could have been better. I would definitely come back if I'm ever in Glendale again. It was also inexpensive about 8-10 a plate (with daily specials of $5-8).
Amazing food, amazing prices and amazing service!!! Ask for Danielle when you go. She'll take care of you.

First time here, even though I only live a few blocks away.  Well my son brought me here for late breakfast/early lunch.  What was I waiting for. This place is fantastic. Nice Mom and Pop place, like the ones I used to go to growing up. The food is wonderful, home made like it should be. Not like the fast food restaurants. I had an omelet that will feed me for a couple of days. My son had the BLT sandwich, and he said it was fantastic.  Need to bring my grandson here,  because he eats and eats and eats. The omelet is large enough to fill him up. All in all, this place is a hidden gem. Definitely worth the drive from anywhere, to enjoy this fantastic place.

The portion sizes here are absolutely huge. So big that I couldn't finish all my food. If anything I'd take smaller sizes for better quality. I also didn't like that the kitchen is open and you can see not so clean things in the kitchen. Like I said though the portion sizes were out of this world.

The food was very bland and not fresh. The omelette had no flavor, the orange juice did not taste fresh,  and the side of fruit was definitely canned. Service was good, but the food was bad enough I'd never go back.
Ronnie's is everything that everyone has said it would be. We will definitely be back! The pancakes are huge and their food is good also. I can't wait to try their biscuits and gravy yum
We love this place. We get one of the skillet breakfasts and share it! The waitresses are always kind and very personable. They make you feel at home and the food is like home cooked as well!

I Yelped "Breakfast Café" and Ronnie's was the first on my list. I read the first two reviews and thought I had found my next favorite Café. I was wrong. The waitresses seem to not know what was going on or which order belonged to what costumer. There was a person next to me who had been waiting for 30 minutes and three times they brought the wrong order to him. I ordered the French Toast and they tasted like they had been reheated. Ronnie's was not what I expected.

I love this place. The staff is like family. The portions are huge and filling. Priced right for what you get. They always make you feel welcome and you always leave full. Try it out and ask for Lisa as your server! She rocks....
This is one of our go to places for breakfast! It's super cheap and the portions are huge so my 2 daughters and I usually share a plate. The cinnamon French toast is amazing!
I had the country fried steak while hubby got a gigantic omelette of some sort. Yeah -the servings were huge. Service was pretty great. Food was ok.

My friends and I ordered Ronnie's Cafe from postmates and it wasn't the best. The pancakes and ham were extremely burnt, the eggs weren't well done and it wasn't packed very well. Not all the food was bad, but it definitely wasn't the best.

Walking up to Ronnie's Cafe I was thinking "Ugh this is going to be another hole in the wall diner grease-fest"  Walking in I changed my mind. I agree with Devin J.  "It may look like it was over-decorated by the kitschiest of grandmothers..." but it had a cozy charm to it. And it seemed most of the decore was for sale! The food may not be the healthiest but it was still really good and the servings are gynormous. The staff and even the patrons were all very friendly. Our waitress even gave my niece a hug and kiss on the cheek when she told her it was her 4th birthday. I had the Adam which is biscuits topped with carved ham and gravy and served with potatoes. SO SO SO GOOD! My dad had the chili omelet and was not happy with it. It was bland, no chili taste to it. It looked more like canned refried beans on it instead of chili, but of the four of us, he was the only one not happy with his food.
More than descent portion sizes for the price with wonderful quick service BUT lacking flavor to make this breakfast place distinct. IHOP for example has better flavors.

I used to come here a few years back with my dad when he was still alive. It was one of his favorite places for a good breakfast. My wife had seen this place the other day as we drove past so yesterday when we were discussing whether to make breakfast at home or go out, I decided to come to Ronnie's.  Upon arrival the parking lot was packed. I expected a long wait. However, we were seated in about 10 minutes.  We immediately noticed the knick knacks on the walls. It gave me a "grandma's house" feeling. It was very pleasant.   Our waitress was very polite and attentive. Couldn't have asked for better.   My 5 year old ordered a pancake breakfast off of the kids/senior menu. The plate consisted of a pancake bigger than I could eat if I tried, eggs, and a big sausage. She loved it!  My wife had an omelet. I don't know what it was but it looked AMAZING!  I ordered a skillet with eggs, potatoes, chorizo, jalapenos, and tons of cheese. I tried as hard as I could to finish it but I only managed to down half. Flavor is spot on. In fact, it is my lunch today.  This place is an absolute must visit!

Great prices & good sized portions.  They have an extensive menu that can tackle pretty much any breakfast craving it seems like. First timers here- I ordered the Country Benedict & my fiance got the Eggs Benedict.  My plate was decent, I liked their homefries, but I honestly prefer hashbrowns myself. The benedict for me was good, but the country gravy wasn't knock my socks off spectacular, I've had better. The food didn't take long but when our plates came out the food was just 'warm.'  If you're looking for a cheap, quick breakfast Ithink this is a good option, but it wasn't super memorable for me.

A mound of expertly cooked bacon on my plate? Check. Fluffy, hot, fresh eggs? Check. Friendly service with a smile? Check. This place has everything one would want in a breakfast spot. Including interesting decor/merchandise on the walls and bottomless piping-hot coffee.

I really enjoyed my meat lovers omelet, I'll definitely be back here.  Only disappointments were the biscuits(dry boring) and they have a watered down off brand of ketchup.  Overall the portion sizes match the price and they get the food out quick, hot, and fresh.  Service was great!

All this food is disgusting tasted like a mop and mildew. The vegetables look like they came from a frozen bag. The coffee is water and gross. Not recommended at all. Everything I ordered was a huge disappointment.
This what u call breakfast!!!!  Family &friendly place awesome. French Toast with a side of bacon eggs, big farmers breakfast just the best.

Went in for breakfast because of the reviews and with the wait I was expecting it to be really good. Unfortunately it didn't live up to the hype. The service was fine and the staff was friendly but the food just wasn't very good. Most of it got left on the table. Not really sure what all the great reviews are about.
This place is not bad. It's not the  best but it is affordable and filling. Service is good and organized. This might be your alternative to IHOP or Denny 's.

I love this place.  If you're looking for comfort breakfast food like biscuits and gravy or steak and eggs, and a couple pounds of it, this is your place.  The menu includes French toast, biscuits and gravy, shit on a shingle, about 15 different omelets, steak and eggs, chicken fried steak and eggs, Belgian waffles, breakfast burritos, etc and lunch items. With almost every breakfast, you get real home-style potatoes and choice of bread. If I go here, I don't eat the rest of the day. Every entree is less than $10 and if you come weekdays before 10:30, there's quite a few specials under $5. Awesome feeling to be full all day for less than $10.  I've being coming here for about 4 years and is my go to for a hangover meal or a hearty meal with my dad.

Delicious breakfast! Had the chorizo scramble and hash browns, with onions and cheese added.   I was disappointed that they were out of cheese grits by the time we got there, but the taters were excellent.  The decor is a bit eclectic, but interesting! The service was excellent! Let them know if it's your birthday and they will gather and sing to you. Very relaxed atmosphere.

Today was our first time eating here, the food was amazing, and the pancakes to die for, good job the place was super busy but they still managed to get us in and give us a table fast as well as the food being brought up very quick
Great food at an affordable price. This is my new favorite place for breakfast.  Beware the pancakes are huge.

My BFF and I just found this place even though he has lived around the corner for 25 years.  Food was fabulous.  I had cheese burger and fries, he had a skillet breakfast with bisquits and gravy.  Waitress was a sweety, helpful and attentive.  Coffee wasn't the best tasting but was served generously.  Prices are great too!  Wish they had cocktails!
Went for breakfast the other weekend. Excellent service, prices are reasonable and the food was very good.  Will be back soon
There was about a 15 minute wait but totally worth it.  The food is delicious,  the portions are BiG and the staff is friendly. My favorite thing was the cinnamon French toast.

Great food and good portions.  I have had breakfast here several times and the portion is always big.   I love the there and wall decor.   The only thing preventing a 5 stat is the dated carpet and furniture.   All in all, one of my favs.
Been here at least a dozen times and never left disappointed or Hungary.  Great food and service!

HUGE portions. Come hungry. Food is definitely reasonably priced. Be prepared for a mix of farm/patriotic decor everywhere you look, but don't look for veteran/military discounts. Aside the the orange juice being frozen concentrate (bleh), the food and drinks are tasty. Skillet cooked hash is always a good thing. Even the shit on a shingle is good. Service can be iffy when they're busy.

Never noticed this place because it doesn't have a big pretentious sign.  Had the chicken fried steak for breakfast.  Generous portions and it was well cooked with just the right amount of spices.  The home fries were huge and also well cooked.  Excellent meal for 10 bucks!!!!  The also have lots of specials so I will be returning  to try the other items!  The service was also great, they always checked in  to top off my coffee and water and they were friendly to boot!!! what a PLUS PLUS PLUS PLUS PLUS PLUS PLUS PLUS

The portions are huge, and for a great price. I got the Meat Lovers Omelet, and it was purely delightful. The Home Fries were great, and is the perfect side for whatever entree you choose. I'm a visitor from CA, and this has to be one of the best breakfast places I have ever eaten at. If you are traveling, you should consider coming to Ronnie's for breakfast. You will not be disappointed.
Great breakfast and it is enough food that you can eat breakfast for the next 2 days. The staff is also wonderful and attentive even though they are busy

Went here today for breakfast our 1st time, walked in and behind the counter was an older lady she just looked at us, I smiled & a waitress said are you here to meet someone? We said no, then she walked away.    So the older lady just looked at us and I was confused, I thought maybe we are to seat ourselves.   A different waitress said how many we said 2 and she walked away.  A different gal came and said 2 and looked so confused to where to seat us, she took us to a table but held our menus looking towards back of resturant to seat us there but then put down our menus.  Then our waitress walked by and said I'll be right with you. Came back for our drink order.  I ordered the Cinnamon French Toast I didn't taste any Cinnamon it was a lot of egg and their syrup is in a Dirty Root Beer Bottle and is hard to come out.  My hubby got the Chili Omelet with the Home Fried Potatoes which where very undercooked, some where still half raw.  Our waitress never came back to our table she dropped off our food with the check.  I wanted a fill up on my coffee our waitress was no where to be seen, so we flagged down a different waitress.  Our plates where sitting there forever and we noticed other tables weren't picked up either.  The bathroom always had a line, I tried to go but it was locked and smelled from the outside so I didn't even bother.  The manager looked so tired and worn down like she didn't want to be there.  The Hostess looked bored and mad the whole time,  she never smiled.  It looks a bit dirty.  It takes forever to pay your bill. On your bill they don't even add the total,  so the old lady has to figure it out in her head so that takes a while and when I went to pay our bill the machine ran out of paper.  Very outdated  Won't be going back  Needs New Manager, New Hostess and New Cashier

Great service and good food. Went around 9 and the place was packed, good sign, but the food came out quickly and fresh. I got the skillet and my dad got the country Benedict. The ingredients aren't anything special but it was great diner food for a good price.
Love eating here! Place is great and every person I've brought here loved it too. There big farmers breakfast is good and their strawberry pancakes is awesome, enough to feed 2-3 people.

Went here for breakfast based on the reviews, mistake.  I was seated by the front door away from everyone, felt isolated.  Ordered french toast combo, eggs--warm and greasy, french toast--one slice warm. one slice so cold the butter won't even melt, bacon--over cooked.   Will keep looking for a breakfast place.

I had a few problems with this place. The bacon that I ordered was a little burned. Also I am not sure what this was about but a employee shouted something that sounded like argument while it was quiet in the restaurant. Other than that the place has got the old feel to it. The French toast was great and the rest of the food was good.

This place is a great place for breakfast or brunch.   I live nearby and knew about Ronnie's for some time, but hadn't occurred to go here until yesterday, after reading some yelp reviews and decided to take a chance.  I was very pleasantly surprised.   I had the country fried steak and white  gravy platter, and my significant other had the western omelet, which I had a taste of.  The portions are great and as to the omelet and country fried steak, they were very great tasting, too.  The home fries are the best.  Between the two of us, we had 2 large breakfasts for under $20.   Go hungry, because you will have leftovers.  The people next to us ordered pancakes, and they were the size of the entire plate.    The waitress was very attentive and very polite, the food was delivered fast (I would say within 15 minutes after we ordered it, or less)and we were seated right away, even though it was very busy.    This was a great experience for both of us, and we will be back soon!   I highly recommend Ronnie's.

I'm not exactly sure why this place gets such good reviews.... The food is pretty mediocre. The portion sizes are out of control. I ordered the breakfast burrito with no sausage...it came out and had sausage in it...boooo. Oh well. I only ate maybe a third of the thing because it was so massive. The flavor was pretty bland...nothing exciting. The BF got biscuits and gravy and a pancake and thought they were really good. I thought they were also pretty meh. I will say the service was excellent and our waitress was very friendly. I wouldn't go back here on my own, but I wouldn't completely refuse to go back here if the BF wanted it again.

Eggs and extra potatoes, with jalepenos in the potatoes. Red gunslinger sauce to cover my plate in spicy goodness is how I like it. I get my protein and spicy and crunchy potatoes fried to perfection. Oh ya and rye toast with no butter. They are my taste buds and I give them five stars.

Great power breafast at this West Valley favorite. They have a number of daily specials. Top sirloin steak and eggs with potatoes and toast is just $7.99. Food was great, service was exceptional, coffee is hot and place is clean. Lots of working folks and regulars. I have been here 5 or 6 times and never disappointed.
Drove into the Phoenix area and was looking for some good local home cooking. I was very please with the omelette I ordered and the staff was very friendly.
What a wonderful place  Great food  Excellent service Smiling faces Family atmosphere  Highly recommend

I've been here twice, once for breakfast....eeehh. Then again for breakfast but I had lunch....which was good.  I chicken sandwich was huge and the fries where really good.   We also had coupons so it made the meal even more affordable. When we get more coupons we will re-visit, LOL.
Huge portions (plates can be shared by 2 people easily). Delicious food and good service.

My wife & I come to Ronnies frequently.  The food and coffee are very good and plentiful.    Their food is heavy calorie wise.  We try to watch our weight but their fare does not help.  they really need to add a few light calorie items.  Other restaurants that did not did not survive.  I don't think Ronnie's would but they need to fill out their menu with some lighter fare.  We usually get take away boxes and have enough for  breakfast the next day.
Great food, great service. Friendly atmosphere.  Waitress was very tentative.  Food was amazing
Husband loved steak and eggs. Pancake was excellent! Hollandaise sauce was horrible! Coffee was yuk. Really good prices!

I have  to say, Ronnies is a great place to eat if your really hungry because they serve good size portions and it is really tasty ! The staff is in a league of their own, they are freindly and always there for your needs !!
New to this place, food is good and as everyone says portions are huge... staff is very friendly...   Definitely going back when I am near there..
Great food..huge portions and very friendly staff.
The food had good flavor mostly, however it was all luke warm and or cold. The staff wasn't rude however they weren't really welcoming either.

We were looking for a breakfast place other than Denny's so my daughter and I decided to give Ronnie's a try.. and we loved it! Our server was very friendly and attentive. We both ordered breakfast specials with eggs, bacon, and pancakes. The pancakes were gigantic! And light and fluffy!   They have a ton of specialties on their menu; next time I'll try one of those.

I have yet to walk out of this place hungry. I know when we are going here, you might be rolling me out! They are open for breakfast and lunch and close at 2PM daily. Breakfast are huge and very filling, the pancakes overhang on a regular dinner plate. I love the sandwiches as well, plenty of meat and more fries than you ever need. Reasonably priced and staff is pleasant as well. This is a can't go wrong type of place.
HUGE portions and the food was EXCELLENT!  Wish this place was in my hometown!  The decor is like your grandmas sun room, but for that food I'll deal with it!

Tried for the first time...Service was great. Super large portions of distasteful, low quality food, similar to golden corral quality. Everything was drenched in oil. Coffee was like water. We had to leave fast because we were near the kitchen, that doesn't have doors, and the oil that was in the air burned our eyes :( if you're looking for low quality, unhealthy, large meals with good service this is the place for you. My French toast  and eggs didn't taste like anything, except oil.
You would not expect this place to be that cozy, super hole in the wall breakfast joint you'd find in Heber/Overgaard or Pinetop. The portions are huge, and the staff is awesome. 5 stars for Ronnies.

Omg delicious food,  hag the pancakes,  just get one,  they are giant.  Next visit I tried the country fried steak, their gravy is yummy and their potatoes are flavorful.  Very down to earth homey feel.

OK, so here's the deal. My wife and I discovered the little gem about 4 years ago and quickly became "regulars." At least once a week we were there. Then the Army sent us to GA for two years. All we did was talk about Ronnie's. And the day we got back to Phoenix, we went to Ronnie's and it was like we never left. The portions are huge (my wife and I always split the Paula and Jim's Skillet). My son, who's 15 and a big eater, has yet to be able to finish a whole pancake. But honestly, the best part about this place is the people. All the wait staff are great, the owner is a sweetheart who acknowledges every customer when they come in and again when they leave and the kitchen guys are geniuses. These guys put out all this food in a kitchen the size of a small walk in closet. Overall, the best breakfast in Phoenix.

This place offers a bang for your buck. We ordered the French toast meal ($6.25) and corn beef/biscuits and gravy. They brought us more food than we could eat. The coffee was nice and smooth. This is important since I don't add sugar to my coffee. You would be surprised how many places have awful coffee (but I digress). We had a little bit of of wait due to the  high volume of customers, but we were seated fairly quick. I have no complaints about this visit.

WARNING fellow Yelpers! The 4 star rating is very deceptive. If you have ever read any of my previous reviews you know I don't pull any punches. I tell it just the way it is. They served me a rotten smelly piece of yellowing NY strip steak with my breakfast. Had it removed and replaced with rotten smelly sausage links and patties. The gravy for the biscuits had the same stench as the rotten meat. I think they used the juice from the putrid meat to flavor the gravy. The odor was so bad it was triggering our gag reflexes continuously! Absolutely disgusting and ruined our appetite completely. Hoping to salvage some of the food, I scraped my remaining food onto the toast plate so it would not be contaminated by the smelly steak juice. It didn't help! My son could not finish his breakfast either! They did remove the steak from the bill but charged for the smelly sausage. Total for this garbage was over $20. We were both wondering why there were numerous full plates of food on various tables but no customers were seated there. I think after one whiff they just up and left. Good for them...saved a trip to the ER! The busser would quickly scoop them up as they left. After we gave the busser our unfinished plates of garbage you could still detect the smell of rotten meat. YUCK!  No wonder they are dog friendly... They're probably cadaver dogs! Ha ha We prob won't be able to eat a traditional type breakfast for weeks if not months!

Cute funky diner that reminds me of a Florida diner I would take my dad. Lots of cute things on the wall and patriotic themed decor. Large plates of food. My breakfast of Cinnamon French Toast with Eggs and sausage was good. Nothing to write home about or die over but good.  Better than most diners in town but a bit pricier than a cheapy breakfast place. Nice servers. I would go back to try lunch.

Just got back form Ronnie's Cafe.  Very interesting place. I drive by there several times a week but did not know they were there. Was looking for a new breakfast spot to try this morning and they were close. This was Saturday morning and the place was pretty busy. We was seated within 5 min. of arriving.  The decor is what I wold call unique. Very unique. Almost like waking into a boutique. Many pictures, plates, cups, magnets. Lots of stuff for sale. Or at least there was price tags on the items. Some of the carpentry work looked almost temporary. Nailed in place but never quite finished. Plenty of light and not so loud where you and the person you was with could not talk easily.  The service. We were treated as valued guests. There were several times to fill the coffee cups and to check if you needed anything else.  The meals. This was breakfast. I got their two eggs, potatoes, toast. Not a complicated meal and it was very good. Way more potatoes than I could eat. I got rye toast and it was better than most places I get rye toast at. My wife got the cinnamon french toast. They make the cinnamon bread there and my wife said it was good. They could have a broader selection of syrup.  Conclusion?? Good place eat breakfast. Food is reasonable priced and good. Service we received was very good. Have a nice day Enjoy
